artifact_name: cup type a(possibly); cup type c(possibly)
Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly a type A or type C cup; interior glazed black; exterior: maenad to left, wearing a leopard skin (head and lower body missing; added white on arms; added red on cloak); vines on either side as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "10" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other AM1371 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1440) (phase 3)
